description: Latin abscessio (“a separation”); from abscedere. See abscess.

entries.meaning: (rare) A separating; a removal; a going away.
examples: I have seen many in the final stage of long illnesses affected by our disease. For Nature has here wished, as it were, in the manner of a crisis in the outer parts of the body to attempt an "abscession" in the sense of an outflow  […]
